data.title: Nigeria to lift Twitter ban after six-month suspension
data.description: Nigeria will lift its ban on Twitter from midnight on Thursday, the government said, a move that will give millions of people in Africa's most populous country access to the social media platform once again.

data.title: Dubai's virtual waiter startup sees a surge in demand during the Covid-19 pandemic
data.description: The Opaala platform, which allows customers to order and pay in restaurants through their smart phones, can also track the preferences of individual diners and create bespoke menus for them.

data.title: More than 80 fact-checking organizations call out YouTube's 'insufficient' response to misinformation
data.description: A group of more than 80 fact-checking organizations from around the world has called YouTube "one of the major conduits of online disinformation and misinformation worldwide" and wants the platform to do more to address the problem.

data.title: Pixar's 'Turning Red' to skip theaters, head straight to Disney+ in March
data.description: "Turning Red" is the third Pixar film to transition to Disney's streaming platform during the pandemic.

data.title: Goldman-backed digital bank Starling boycotts Meta over scam ads
data.description: Starling CEO Anne Boden said her firm would no longer pay for advertising on Facebook and Instagram while scammers target customers.
